docs.snippet: The Cities Service Company had the most successful year in its history in 1929, according to the annual report of the company, mailed to stockholders yesterday. Total assets, net earnings, gross earnings and the number of security holders in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cities Service Company had the most successful year in its history in 1929, according to the annual report of the company, mailed to stockholders yesterday. Total assets, net earnings, gross earnings and the number of security holders in the company reach new high record figures.

headline.main: CITIES SERVICE NET $69,734,315 IN 1929; Annual Report Shows Increase of $5,680,000 in Earnings Over 1928 Record. 750,000 NOW OWN STOCK Total Assets Pass Billion Mark-- Larger Profits for Current Year Are Predicted. Electric Earnings Up 37 Per Cent. Oil Operations Enlarged. To Expand Pipe Line Facilities.

docs.snippet: LARCHMONT, N.Y., April 21.-- Pemberton Smith, retired civil engi  neer and executive of steel concerns, died here yesterday at his home, 72 Stuyvesant Avenue, after a long illness. He was 64 years old.
docs.lead_paragraph: LARCHMONT, N.Y., April 21.-- Pemberton Smith, retired civil engi neer and executive of steel concerns, died here yesterday at his home, 72 Stuyvesant Avenue, after a long illness. He was 64 years old.

headline.main: PEMBERTON SMITH, ENGINEER, DIES AT 64; Had Been Representative of Steel Corporations in Foreign Countries. SOLD MUNITIONS TO FRANCE Greatly Interested in South America --Began Career as Railroad Maintenance Engineer.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: In an address regarded by business leaders as significant of a new spirit in Latin-American relations, Dr. Enrique Olaya Herrera, President-elect of Colombia, at a luncheon of the Colombian-American Chamber of Commerce in his honor at India...
docs.lead_paragraph: In an address regarded by business leaders as significant of a new spirit in Latin-American relations, Dr. Enrique Olaya Herrera, President-elect of Colombia, at a luncheon of the Colombian-American Chamber of Commerce in his honor at India...

headline.main: DR. OLAYA PLEDGES 'FAIR PLAY' TO US; President-Elect of Colombia Sees New Era of Progress in Pan-American Relations. BUSINESS MEN CHEER HIM He Is Guest of Colombian Group at Luncheon--Received by Walker at City Hall. Sees New Period of Progress. Praised as a Liberal. Thanks Acting Secretary Cotton.

docs.snippet: PARIS, April 24.--A council of war was held this afternoon at tha Paris home of Mrs. O.H.P. Belmont by the American feminists who attended The Hague conference for the codification of international law, where ...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, April 24.--A council of war was held this afternoon at tha Paris home of Mrs. O.H.P. Belmont by the American feminists who attended The Hague conference for the codification of international law, where ...
docs.abstract: Women plan opposition to Hague convention, at Paris meeting

headline.main: WOMEN TO CONTINUE NATIONALITY FIGHT; Plan at Mrs. Belmont's Paris Home to Oppose Ratification of The Hague Convention. OUR DELEGATES PRAISED Miss Stevens Says New World Stands Back of Campaign Against Discrimination.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MIAMI, Fla., April 25 (AP).--Colonel Charles A. Lindbergh set his specially-built plane down at Pan-American Airport at 4:47 P.M. today to prepare for his third inaugural air mail flight into Latin-America.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI, Fla., April 25 (AP).--Colonel Charles A. Lindbergh set his specially-built plane down at Pan-American Airport at 4:47 P.M. today to prepare for his third inaugural air mail flight into Latin-America.

headline.main: LINDBERGH IN MIAMI AFTER FAST FLIGHT; He Covers 990 Miles From the Capital to Florida City in 7 Hours 12 Minutes. TO START ARGENTINE MAIL He Will Inaugurate Service Which Will Cross the Andes From Chile to Buenos Aires. Fliers in Impromptu Meeting.
